entities.name: gpu_terrain.py::main
entities.docstring:
Main entry point for the GPU terrain generation CLI.
Handles argument parsing, generator initialization, execution, and artifact export.

entities.name: gpu_terrain_old.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator
entities.docstring:
GPU-accelerated terrain generator using hydraulic-style erosion.

Key features:
- All important parameters are uniforms (no shader #defines),
  so you can drive them from a UI.
- Domain warping (u_warpStrength, u_warpFrequency) reduces obvious tiling.

entities.name: gpu_terrain_old.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator.__init__
entities.docstring:
Args:
    resolution: Texture size (heightmap is resolution x resolution).
    use_erosion: Whether to run the erosion octaves at all.
    scale: Base tiling factor (used as default for height/erosion tiles).
    erosion_strength: Default erosion strength.
    slope_strength: Default slope strength.
    ctx: Optional existing moderngl.Context. If None, a standalone
         context is created and owned by this instance.

entities.name: gpu_terrain_old.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator._create_detail_texture
entities.docstring: Create a noise texture for high-frequency detail.

entities.name: gpu_terrain_old.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator.generate_heightmap
entities.docstring:
Generate terrain heightmap on GPU.

Args:
    seed: Random seed for the shader.
    seamless: If True, generates a seamlessly tileable heightmap.
              This forces tiles to be integers and disables domain rotation.
    overrides: Optional overrides for any of the default parameters.

Returns:
    dict with 'height', 'normals', 'erosion_mask' (all np.float32 arrays)

entities.name: gpu_terrain_old.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator.render_visualization
entities.docstring:
Render the generated heightmap to a colored image using the visualization shader.
mode: 0=Shaded, 1=Height, 2=Normals, 3=Erosion, 4=Slope

entities.docstring: Render the terrain using 3D raymarching.

entities.docstring: Analyze terrain statistics and plot histograms, CDF, and FFT.

entities.name: src/config.py::TerrainConfig
entities.docstring:
Complete configuration for terrain generation and rendering.

This combines terrain generation parameters, render settings, and
output configuration into a single serializable structure.

entities.docstring: Extract terrain generation parameters.

entities.name: src/config.py::TerrainConfig.get_hydraulic_params
entities.docstring: Extract hydraulic erosion parameters.

entities.name: src/config.py::TerrainConfig.get_render_config
entities.docstring: Extract rendering parameters.

entities.name: src/config.py::TerrainConfig.apply_terrain_preset
entities.docstring: Apply a terrain generation preset.

entities.name: src/config.py::TerrainConfig.apply_render_preset
entities.docstring: Apply a render configuration preset.

entities.name: src/config.py::TerrainConfig.to_dict
entities.docstring: Convert to dictionary for serialization.

entities.docstring: Create from dictionary.

entities.docstring: Save configuration to YAML file.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionParams
entities.docstring:
Represents configurable parameters for terrain height and erosion
generation, including presets for canyons, plains, mountains, and
natural terrain. Provides methods to create modified copies and export
parameters as dictionaries.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionParams.canyon
entities.docstring: Preset: Deep erosion with branching valleys.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionParams.plains
entities.docstring: Preset: Gentle rolling hills with minimal erosion.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionParams.mountains
entities.docstring: Preset: Sharp peaks with moderate erosion.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionParams.natural
entities.docstring: Preset: Organic terrain combining ridge noise and domain warping.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionParams.override
entities.docstring:
Updates the current ErosionParams instance by applying the given
overrides dictionary and returns a new ErosionParams object with the
updated values.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator
entities.docstring: GPU-accelerated generator with optional visualization pipelines.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator._compile_program
entities.docstring:
Compiles and returns a moderngl.Program by loading and combining the
specified vertex (vert) and fragment (frag) shader source files.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator._create_framebuffers
entities.docstring:
Initializes heightmap and visualization framebuffers and textures using
the current OpenGL context, configuring their size, format, and
filtering for terrain generation and visualization.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator._create_geometry
entities.docstring:
Initializes a quad geometry by creating vertex and index buffers and
sets up a vertex array object for rendering with the height shader
program using moderngl.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator.generate_heightmap
entities.docstring:
Generates a terrain heightmap using the specified seed and optional
seamless tiling, applying parameter overrides. Renders the heightmap
with erosion effects via OpenGL, extracts height, normal, and erosion
mask data, and returns them as a TerrainMaps object.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator.apply_thermal_erosion
entities.docstring:
Applies thermal erosion (talus deposition) to the heightmap.
This simulates material falling down steep slopes.

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator.render_visualization
entities.docstring:
Renders a visualization of the terrain using the erosion_viz shader.

Args:
    water_height: Height of the water plane (0.0 to 1.0).
    sun_dir: Direction vector of the sun light.
    mode: Visualization mode (0=Standard, 1=Height, 2=Normals,
          3=Erosion, 4=Slope, 5=Curvature).
    time: Time in seconds for animation (water, clouds).

Returns:
    A numpy array of shape (resolution, resolution, 3) containing the
    rendered image data (RGB).

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator.render_raymarch
entities.docstring:
Renders a high-quality raymarched view of the terrain with advanced
lighting effects.

Args:
    camera_pos: Position of the camera in world space.
    look_at: Target point the camera is looking at.
    water_height: Height of the water plane.
    sun_dir: Direction vector of the sun light.
    time: Time in seconds for animation.
    exposure: Exposure multiplier for tone mapping.
    fog_color: Color of the atmospheric fog.
    fog_density: Density of the distance fog.
    fog_height: Height falloff for the height fog.
    sun_intensity: Intensity multiplier for direct sunlight.
    ray_max_steps: Maximum number of raymarching steps.
    ray_min_step: Minimum step size for raymarching.
    shadow_softness: Softness factor for shadows (higher = sharper).
    ao_strength: Strength of ambient occlusion (0.0 to 1.0+).

Returns:
    A numpy array of shape (resolution, resolution, 3) containing the
    rendered image data (RGB).

entities.name: src/generators/erosion.py::ErosionTerrainGenerator._uniform_name
entities.docstring:
Converts a snake_case field name to a GLSL uniform name (camelCase with
u_ prefix).

entities.name: src/generators/hydraulic.py::HydraulicParams
entities.docstring:
Parameters for hydraulic erosion simulation.

Attributes:
    iterations: Number of simulation steps.
    dt: Time step per iteration.
    pipe_length: Length of virtual pipes (L).
    sediment_capacity: Sediment capacity constant (Kc).
    soil_dissolving: Soil dissolving constant (Ks).
    sediment_deposition: Sediment deposition constant (Kd).
    evaporation_rate: Water evaporation rate (Ke).
    rain_rate: Amount of rain added per step (optional).
    thermal_erosion_rate: Rate of thermal erosion (talus deposition).
    talus_angle: Critical angle for thermal erosion (tangent of angle).

entities.name: src/generators/hydraulic.py::HydraulicErosionGenerator
entities.docstring:
GPU-accelerated hydraulic erosion simulator using the pipe model.
Implements a multi-stage simulation pipeline:
1. Flux computation (water movement)
2. Water velocity & depth update
3. Erosion & Deposition (sediment transport)
4. Sediment Advection (movement with flow)
5. Evaporation
6. Thermal Erosion (slope stabilization)

entities.name: src/generators/hydraulic.py::HydraulicErosionGenerator.simulate
entities.docstring:
Runs the hydraulic erosion simulation on the given heightmap.

Args:
    initial_heightmap: Initial terrain heightmap (2D numpy array).
    params: Simulation parameters.

Returns:
    A TerrainMaps object containing the eroded heightmap, normals, and
    sediment mask.

entities.name: src/utils/advanced_rendering.py::_height_array
entities.docstring: Extract height array from terrain data.

entities.name: src/utils/advanced_rendering.py::render_turntable_frames
entities.docstring:
Render a turntable sequence by rotating the light source around the terrain.

Args:
    terrain: Terrain data (TerrainMaps or compatible dict)
    frames: Number of frames to generate (one full rotation)
    altitude: Sun altitude angle in degrees
    vert_exag: Vertical exaggeration for shading
    colormap: Matplotlib colormap name
    blend_mode: Shading blend mode

Returns:
    List of RGB uint8 arrays, one per frame

entities.name: src/utils/advanced_rendering.py::save_turntable_video
entities.docstring:
Save a turntable animation as an MP4 video file.

Requires ffmpeg to be installed on the system.
Falls back to GIF if ffmpeg is not available.

Args:
    path: Output file path (.mp4 or .gif)
    terrain: Terrain data
    frames: Number of frames in full rotation
    fps: Frames per second
    **render_kwargs: Additional arguments passed to render_turntable_frames

Returns:
    Path to saved file

entities.name: src/utils/advanced_rendering.py::render_multi_angle
entities.docstring:
Render terrain from multiple lighting angles.

Args:
    terrain: Terrain data
    angles: List of (azimuth, altitude) tuples in degrees.
            Defaults to cardinal directions + zenith
    **render_kwargs: Additional rendering parameters

Returns:
    List of rendered images, one per angle

entities.name: src/utils/advanced_rendering.py::create_comparison_grid
entities.docstring:
Create a grid comparison of multiple terrains.

Args:
    terrains: Sequence of terrain data objects
    labels: Optional labels for each terrain
    figsize: Figure size (width, height) in inches
    dpi: Figure DPI
    **render_kwargs: Rendering parameters

Returns:
    Matplotlib figure

entities.name: src/utils/advanced_rendering.py::render_lighting_study
entities.docstring:
Create a lighting study showing terrain under various light conditions.

Useful for understanding how lighting affects terrain appearance.

Args:
    terrain: Terrain data
    azimuth_steps: Number of azimuth angles to test
    altitude_steps: Number of altitude angles to test
    figsize: Figure size override
    dpi: Figure DPI
    **render_kwargs: Additional rendering parameters

Returns:
    Matplotlib figure with grid of lighting variations

entities.name: src/utils/advanced_rendering.py::save_animation_sequence
entities.docstring:
Save a custom animation sequence as individual PNG frames.

Args:
    output_dir: Directory to save frames
    terrain: Terrain data
    sequence_func: Function(frame_index, total_frames) -> RGB array
    frame_count: Total number of frames to generate
    name_pattern: Filename pattern (must include one format placeholder for frame number)
    progress_callback: Optional callback(current, total) for progress updates

Returns:
    List of paths to saved frames

entities.name: src/utils/artifacts.py::TerrainMaps
entities.docstring: Container for GPU terrain outputs with handy conversions.

entities.name: src/utils/batch.py::BatchGenerator
entities.docstring: Manages batch generation of terrain maps with varied parameters.

entities.name: src/utils/batch.py::BatchGenerator.generate_set
entities.docstring:
Generate multiple terrains with different seeds.

Args:
    seeds: List of random seeds for variation
    prefix: Filename prefix for exports
    export_formats: List of formats to export ('png', 'obj', 'stl', 'npz')
    progress_callback: Optional callback(current, total, status_msg)
    **generation_kwargs: Parameters passed to generator

Returns:
    List of generated TerrainMaps

entities.name: src/utils/batch.py::BatchGenerator._export_terrain
entities.docstring: Export terrain in multiple formats.

entities.name: src/utils/batch.py::BatchGenerator.cleanup
entities.docstring: Release GPU resources.

entities.name: src/utils/batch.py::generate_terrain_set
entities.docstring:
Convenience function to generate a set of terrains.

Args:
    count: Number of terrains to generate
    base_seed: Starting seed (will increment)
    generator: 'erosion' or 'morph'
    resolution: Texture resolution
    output_dir: Output directory path
    formats: Export formats ('png', 'obj', 'stl', 'npz', 'shaded')
    **kwargs: Additional generation parameters

Returns:
    List of generated TerrainMaps

entities.name: src/utils/export.py::save_heightmap_png
entities.docstring: Write a 16-bit PNG heightmap to disk.

entities.name: src/utils/export.py::save_heightmap_raw
entities.docstring: Write raw 16-bit little-endian heightmap data (Mac/Windows/Linux compatible).

entities.name: src/utils/export.py::save_heightmap_r32
entities.docstring: Write raw 32-bit float little-endian heightmap data.

entities.name: src/utils/export.py::export_obj_mesh
entities.docstring: Export the terrain heightmap as a simple grid mesh OBJ.

entities.name: src/utils/export.py::export_stl_mesh
entities.docstring: Export the terrain heightmap as a binary STL mesh.

entities.name: src/utils/gl_context.py::create_context
entities.docstring:
Create a standalone ModernGL context.

Falls back to the default backend if EGL is unavailable.

entities.name: src/utils/gl_context.py::create_detail_texture
entities.docstring: Create a small tiling noise texture used by the raymarch renderer.

entities.name: src/utils/postprocessing.py::apply_tonemapping
entities.docstring:
Apply tonemapping to HDR-like image data.

Args:
    img_array: RGB image array (0-1 range or HDR values)
    method: Tonemapping algorithm to use
    exposure: Exposure adjustment factor

Returns:
    Tonemapped RGB array (0-1 range)

entities.name: src/utils/postprocessing.py::apply_color_grading
entities.docstring:
Apply color grading adjustments.

Args:
    img_array: RGB image array (0-1 range)
    temperature: Color temperature shift (-1 to 1, warm/cool)
    tint: Tint adjustment (-1 to 1, green/magenta)
    saturation: Saturation multiplier
    contrast: Contrast multiplier
    brightness: Brightness offset
    gamma: Gamma correction

Returns:
    Color graded RGB array

entities.name: src/utils/postprocessing.py::apply_bloom_effect
entities.docstring:
Apply bloom/glow effect to bright areas.

Args:
    img_array: RGB image array (0-1 range)
    threshold: Brightness threshold for bloom
    intensity: Bloom intensity
    blur_radius: Blur radius for bloom

Returns:
    Image with bloom effect applied

entities.name: src/utils/postprocessing.py::apply_ssao_approximation
entities.docstring:
Apply screen-space ambient occlusion approximation based on heightmap.

Args:
    height_array: Height values (0-1 range)
    radius: Sample radius for occlusion
    intensity: Occlusion intensity

Returns:
    AO map (0-1 range, 0=fully occluded)

entities.name: src/utils/postprocessing.py::apply_sharpening
entities.docstring:
Apply sharpening to enhance detail.

Args:
    img_array: RGB image array (0-1 range)
    amount: Sharpening strength
    method: Sharpening algorithm

Returns:
    Sharpened image

entities.name: src/utils/postprocessing.py::apply_atmospheric_perspective
entities.docstring:
Apply atmospheric perspective (fog/haze based on elevation).

Args:
    img_array: RGB image array (0-1 range)
    height_array: Height values (0-1 range)
    fog_color: RGB fog/sky color
    fog_density: Overall fog density
    fog_height_falloff: How quickly fog dissipates with height

Returns:
    Image with atmospheric perspective applied

entities.name: src/utils/rendering.py::shade_heightmap
entities.docstring: Return an RGB uint8 array representing shaded relief.

entities.name: src/utils/rendering.py::save_shaded_relief_png
entities.docstring: Save :func:`shade_heightmap` output as a PNG file.

entities.name: src/utils/rendering.py::slope_intensity
entities.docstring: Return a grayscale slope map derived from height gradients.

entities.name: src/utils/rendering.py::save_slope_map_png
entities.docstring: Save :func:`slope_intensity` output as an 8-bit PNG.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig
entities.docstring: Comprehensive rendering configuration for terrain visualization.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.classic
entities.docstring: Classic northwest lighting - most common cartographic style.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.dramatic
entities.docstring: Low-angle dramatic lighting with high contrast.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.noon
entities.docstring: High overhead sun - minimal shadows.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.sunrise
entities.docstring: Warm sunrise lighting from the east.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.sunset
entities.docstring: Warm sunset lighting from the west.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.flat
entities.docstring: Flat shading - no relief, pure elevation colors.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.contour
entities.docstring: High contrast for contour-like appearance.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.technical
entities.docstring: Clean technical visualization.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.artistic_vibrant
entities.docstring: Vibrant artistic style with saturated colors.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.monochrome
entities.docstring: Black and white relief shading.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.underwater
entities.docstring: Underwater bathymetry style.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.alpine
entities.docstring: Alpine terrain with snow caps.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.desert
entities.docstring: Hot desert appearance.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.debug_normals
entities.docstring: Show normal map visualization.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.debug_erosion
entities.docstring: Show erosion mask visualization.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.debug_slope
entities.docstring: Show slope angle visualization.

entities.name: src/utils/render_configs.py::RenderConfig.debug_curvature
entities.docstring: Show surface curvature visualization.

entities.name: src/utils/shader_loader.py::load_shader
entities.docstring: Return the contents of a shader file located under ``src/shaders``.

entities.name: src/utils/textures.py::save_splatmap_rgba
entities.docstring:
Export a 4-channel splatmap for texture blending in game engines.

Channels:
    R: Low terrain (beach/grass)
    G: Mid terrain (grass/dirt)
    B: High terrain (rock/snow)
    A: Steep slopes (cliffs)

Args:
    path: Output file path
    terrain: TerrainMaps instance
    height_thresholds: (low, mid, high) height breakpoints
    slope_threshold: Normal.y threshold for steep detection

Returns:
    Path to saved file

entities.name: src/utils/textures.py::save_ao_map
entities.docstring:
Generate and save an ambient occlusion approximation.

Uses local height variance as a proxy for occlusion.

Args:
    path: Output file path
    terrain: TerrainMaps instance
    radius: Sample radius in pixels
    strength: AO intensity multiplier

Returns:
    Path to saved file

entities.name: src/utils/textures.py::save_curvature_map
entities.docstring:
Generate and save a curvature map (convex=bright, concave=dark).

Args:
    path: Output file path
    terrain: TerrainMaps instance
    scale: Curvature intensity scaling

Returns:
    Path to saved file

entities.name: src/utils/textures.py::save_packed_texture
entities.docstring:
Save a multi-channel packed texture for efficient storage.

Pack modes:
    'unity_mask': R=Metallic, G=AO, B=Detail, A=Smoothness
    'ue_orm': R=AO, G=Roughness, B=Metallic
    'height_normal_ao': R=Height, G=NormalX, B=NormalZ, A=AO

Args:
    path: Output file path
    terrain: TerrainMaps instance
    pack_mode: Packing scheme

Returns:
    Path to saved file

entities.name: src/utils/textures.py::_compute_simple_ao
entities.docstring: Fast AO approximation using height variance.

entities.name: src/utils/visualization.py::plot_terrain_panels
entities.docstring: Render shaded relief, raw height, and erosion mask panels.

entities.name: src/utils/visualization.py::create_turntable_animation
entities.docstring: Create a simple turntable animation using rotating light direction.
